in hot water.</h2><h2 class="font-k text-4 font-black  lg:border-b border-gray-900 pb-1">Suburban Wasteland</h2><p>Tesla is seriously struggling to find enough room for all of its unsold Cybertrucks.</p><div class="mtc-unit mtc-unit-container lg:hidden"><div id="InContent1"></div></div><p>In a particularly dramatic example, the increasingly unpopular pickups have been piling up in the parking lot of a shuttered Bed Bath & Beyond store in a Detroit suburb shopping center, <a href="https://www.autonews.com/tesla/an-tesla-lot-takeover-controversy-0527/" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033"><em>Automotive News</em> reports</a>, in a violation of local code.</p><p>The landlord was notified that the vehicle storage was not "permitted," and local officials have started the "enforcement process," per <em>Automotive News</em>.</p><p>It's yet another sign that Tesla's Cybertruck has been a major flop. Earlier this month, <a href="https://electrek.co/2025/05/05/tesla-cybertruck-inventory-skyrockets-to-record-high/" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033"><em>Electrek</em> reported</a> that Tesla had amassed over 10,000 units worth a staggering $800 million of unsold Cybertruck inventory.</p><p>The EV maker has also reportedly <a class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" href="https://futurism.com/cybertruck-disaster-production" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">slowed down production</a> and moved workers from the line entirely at its manufacturing facility in Texas, indicating massively waning demand and growing anti-Tesla sentiment.</p><h2 class="font-k text-4 font-black  lg:border-b border-gray-900 pb-1">Paper Weight</h2><p>What to do with all of these unsold Cybertrucks has seemingly become a major issue. A <a href="https://www.instagram.com/reel/DJu5GO1ADWd/%20" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">video</a> that went viral on Instagram last week showed rows of the stainless steel-clad vehicles sitting in the otherwise deserted parking lot.</p><p>"Look at what you're missing," a person in the video joked. "Need a Cybertruck? We got you."</p><p>Tesla's sales have <a href="https://futurism.com/elon-musk-horrible-new-sales-data-tesla" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">fallen off a cliff worldwide</a>, largely a result of backlash against Musk's embrace of far-right idealism and a surge in cheaper — and often better — alternatives, particularly from China.</p><p>The Cybertruck has become the poster child of the burgeoning anti-Tesla movement, resulting in frequent <a href="https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-spotted-graffiti" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">vandalism</a> and <a href="https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-owner-mocked-children" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">outright mockery</a>.</p><p>And top top it all off, used Cybertruck prices are <a href="https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-depreciate" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">cratering</a>, making it an extremely costly and unwise investment.</p><p class=""><strong>More on the Cybertruck: </strong><em><a href="https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-fsd-gta" class="underline hover:text-the-byte hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out" style="text-decoration-color:#ff0033">Watch in Horror as Cybertruck Driver Plays "Grand Theft Auto" While Screaming Down Highway on Self-Driving Mode</a></em></p><br/><div class="tracking-[.05em] text-center uppercase font-k  text-the-byte block Cybertrucks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn a particularly dramatic example, the increasingly unpopular pickups have been piling up in the parking lot of a shuttered Bed Bath \u0026amp; Beyond store in a Detroit suburb shopping center, \u003ca href=\"https://www.autonews.com/tesla/an-tesla-lot-takeover-controversy-0527/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAutomotive News\u003c/em\u003e reports\u003c/a\u003e, in a violation of local code.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe landlord was notified that the vehicle storage was not \"permitted,\" and local officials have started the \"enforcement process,\" per \u003cem\u003eAutomotive News\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt's yet another sign that Tesla's Cybertruck has been a major flop. Earlier this month, \u003ca href=\"https://electrek.co/2025/05/05/tesla-cybertruck-inventory-skyrockets-to-record-high/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eElectrek\u003c/em\u003e reported\u003c/a\u003e that Tesla had amassed over 10,000 units worth a staggering $800 million of unsold Cybertruck inventory.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe EV maker has also reportedly \u003ca class=\"underline hover:text-futurism hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out\" href=\"https://futurism.com/cybertruck-disaster-production\"\u003eslowed down production\u003c/a\u003e and moved workers from the line entirely at its manufacturing facility in Texas, indicating massively waning demand and growing anti-Tesla sentiment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003ePaper Weight\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat to do with all of these unsold Cybertrucks has seemingly become a major issue. A \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/reel/DJu5GO1ADWd/%20\"\u003evideo\u003c/a\u003e that went viral on Instagram last week showed rows of the stainless steel-clad vehicles sitting in the otherwise deserted parking lot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\"Look at what you're missing,\" a person in the video joked. \"Need a Cybertruck? We got you.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTesla's sales have \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/elon-musk-horrible-new-sales-data-tesla\"\u003efallen off a cliff worldwide\u003c/a\u003e, largely a result of backlash against Musk's embrace of far-right idealism and a surge in cheaper — and often better — alternatives, particularly from China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Cybertruck has become the poster child of the burgeoning anti-Tesla movement, resulting in frequent \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-spotted-graffiti\"\u003evandalism\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-owner-mocked-children\"\u003eoutright mockery\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd top top it all off, used Cybertruck prices are \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-depreciate\"\u003ecratering\u003c/a\u003e, making it an extremely costly and unwise investment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMore on the Cybertruck: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-fsd-gta\"\u003eWatch in Horror as Cybertruck Driver Plays \"Grand Theft Auto\" While Screaming Down Cybertrucks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn a particularly dramatic example, the increasingly unpopular pickups have been piling up in the parking lot of a shuttered Bed Bath \u0026amp; Beyond store in a Detroit suburb shopping center, \u003ca href=\"https://www.autonews.com/tesla/an-tesla-lot-takeover-controversy-0527/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eAutomotive News\u003c/em\u003e reports\u003c/a\u003e, in a violation of local code.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe landlord was notified that the vehicle storage was not \"permitted,\" and local officials have started the \"enforcement process,\" per \u003cem\u003eAutomotive News\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt's yet another sign that Tesla's Cybertruck has been a major flop. Earlier this month, \u003ca href=\"https://electrek.co/2025/05/05/tesla-cybertruck-inventory-skyrockets-to-record-high/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eElectrek\u003c/em\u003e reported\u003c/a\u003e that Tesla had amassed over 10,000 units worth a staggering $800 million of unsold Cybertruck inventory.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe EV maker has also reportedly \u003ca class=\"underline hover:text-futurism hover:no-underline transition-all duration-200 ease-in-out\" href=\"https://futurism.com/cybertruck-disaster-production\"\u003eslowed down production\u003c/a\u003e and moved workers from the line entirely at its manufacturing facility in Texas, indicating massively waning demand and growing anti-Tesla sentiment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003ePaper Weight\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat to do with all of these unsold Cybertrucks has seemingly become a major issue. A \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/reel/DJu5GO1ADWd/%20\"\u003evideo\u003c/a\u003e that went viral on Instagram last week showed rows of the stainless steel-clad vehicles sitting in the otherwise deserted parking lot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\"Look at what you're missing,\" a person in the video joked. \"Need a Cybertruck? We got you.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTesla's sales have \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/elon-musk-horrible-new-sales-data-tesla\"\u003efallen off a cliff worldwide\u003c/a\u003e, largely a result of backlash against Musk's embrace of far-right idealism and a surge in cheaper — and often better — alternatives, particularly from China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Cybertruck has become the poster child of the burgeoning anti-Tesla movement, resulting in frequent \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-spotted-graffiti\"\u003evandalism\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/the-byte/cybertruck-owner-mocked-children\"\u003eoutright mockery\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd top top it all off, used Cybertruck prices are \u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-depreciate\"\u003ecratering\u003c/a\u003e, making it an extremely costly and unwise investment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMore on the Cybertruck: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://futurism.com/tesla-cybertruck-fsd-gta\"\u003eWatch in Horror as Cybertruck Driver Plays \"Grand Theft Auto\" While Screaming Down Highway on Self-Driving text:
Rewritten: Tesla Can't Find Legal Places to Store All Its Unsold Cybertrucks

Tesla's in hot water.

Suburban Wasteland

Tesla is seriously struggling to find enough room for all of its unsold Cybertrucks.

In a particularly dramatic example, the increasingly unpopular pickups have been piling up in the parking lot of a shuttered Bed Bath & Beyond store in a Detroit suburb shopping center, Automotive News reports, in a violation of local code.

The landlord was notified that the vehicle storage was not "permitted," and local officials have started the "enforcement process," per Automotive News.

It's yet another sign that Tesla's Cybertruck has been a major flop. Earlier this month, Electrek reported that Tesla had amassed over 10,000 units worth a staggering $800 million of unsold Cybertruck inventory.

The EV maker has also reportedly slowed down production and moved workers from the line entirely at its manufacturing facility in Texas, indicating massively waning demand and growing anti-Tesla sentiment.

Paper Weight

What to do with all of these unsold Cybertrucks has seemingly become a major issue. A video that went viral on Instagram last week showed rows of the stainless steel-clad vehicles sitting in the otherwise deserted parking lot.

"Look at what you're missing," a person in the video joked. "Need a Cybertruck? We got you."
